document: Software Evolution and Maintenance: Chapter 7 - Refactoring by Tripathy & Naik

questions.question: According to the document, what are the three consequences of software evolving away from its original design?
options: Increased complexity, increased cost, and increased reliability
Decreased understandability, decreased reliability, and increased maintenance cost
Decreased cost, increased understandability, and decreased reliability
Decreased documentation, increased speed, and decreased cost
questions.answer: Decreased understandability, decreased reliability, and increased maintenance cost

questions.question: Which of the following is cited as a reason for decreased understandability in software?
What is the informal definition of software restructuring?
options: Adding new features to the software
Modifying software to make it easier to understand and change
Rewriting software in a more modern programming language
Increasing the hardware requirements of the software
questions.answer: Modifying software to make it easier to understand and change

questions.question: Restructuring aims to increase 'internal software value.' What does this mean?
options: The software has fewer faults for the customer
The software is more expensive to purchase
The system is less expensive to maintain
The software has a better user interface
questions.answer: The system is less expensive to maintain

questions.question: Which of these is provided as a simple example of restructuring?
What is a key characteristic of the restructuring process regarding external behavior?
options: It must add at least one new requirement
It changes the external behavior to improve performance
It preserves the external behavior of the original program
It requires a complete rewrite in a new language
questions.answer: It preserves the external behavior of the original program

questions.question: In terms of programming languages, what usually happens during restructuring?

options: A program is converted from C to Java
A program is restructured into the same language
The program is converted into machine code
The language is irrelevant to the process
output.answer: A program is restructured into the same language

questions.question: What is the first activity in a refactoring process?
Which artifacts can a programmer use to identify what to refactor?
options: Source code, design documents, and requirements documents
questions.answer: Source code, design documents, and requirements documents

questions.question: What is defined as 'any symptom in source code that possibly indicates a deeper problem'?
Which of the following is NOT listed as an example of a code smell?
In the LAN simulator example, what does refactoring R1 involve?
options: Renaming method 'print' to 'process' in class PrintServer
Moving a method to the Packet class
questions.answer: Renaming method 'print' to 'process' in class PrintServer

questions.question: According to the document, why must R1 and R2 be applied together?
options: They are related renames across different classes (PrintServer and FileServer)
They both involve the Packet class
questions.answer: They are related renames across different classes (PrintServer and FileServer)

questions.question: What does refactoring R7 (Encapsulate field receiver in Packet) aim to prevent?
options: Direct access to the field by another class
questions.answer: Direct access to the field by another class

questions.question: In the refactoring process, why is a subset of refactorings carefully chosen?
options: To ensure the software becomes faster
Because some refactorings must be applied in a specific order or are mutually exclusive
Because the compiler can only handle a few changes at a time
questions.answer: Because some refactorings must be applied in a specific order or are mutually exclusive

questions.question: Which refactorings from the example are noted as being mutually exclusive?
What is the required order if both R1 and R8 are to be applied?
According to the LAN simulator class diagram (Figure 7.1), which class contains the 'originate()' method?
Which activity in the refactoring process ensures the code still works as intended after changes?
options: Ensure that refactoring preserves the software's behavior
questions.answer: Ensure that refactoring preserves the software's behavior

questions.question: What is the ultimate higher-level goal of restructuring mentioned in the text?
options: To reduce the number of developers needed
To increase the software value (internal and external)
To eliminate the need for documentation
questions.answer: To increase the software value (internal and external)
